result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Nnamdi A Opara.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for bail/bond hearing. 
Court previously quashed the warrants at the request of Atty Nimmer. 
Defense requests that bonds be reinstated. 
Court reinstates the bond across all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Per order of Judge Dorow on 9/19/2022 - the warrant is quashed, and a bail/bond hearing will be scheduled.

Letter from Attorney Nimmer requesting that the defendant either appear via Zoom to address the warrants in his cases, or that the warrant be quashed and a plea/sentencing date be scheduled.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/19/2022 - The court agrees to quash the warrant; however, a bail/bond hearing will be set this week, for which Mr. Opara must appear by Zoom video.**

9:51 AM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara not in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Nnamdi A Opara.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Nimmer advises the court that she was not sure if Defendant received notice. 
Court notes mailed notice was not returned. Atty Nimmer was unable to reach the Defendant during the hearing. 
Court issues a Branch 2 Only Capias and revokes bond.

Branch 2 Only

Bail-Jumping: Waukesha County 21CM103
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:28 AM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara not in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Nnamdi A Opara.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases were set for plea and sentencing, but there have been recent developments. Court waves his appearance today. 
Court sets a status hearing. 
If Defendant isn't in custody, he may appear by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.  **Rescheduled due to Jury Trial.**

10:06 AM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nnamdi A Opara appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case called for status.
Defense requests a tentative plea and sentencing date. 
Atty Nimmer needs a current phone number. Defendant to email his Attorney.
Defendant to appear in person or a capias will issue. 


  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nnamdi A Opara appeared by video means with Attorney.
Cases called for status.
Defense has received all of the discovery across all the cases except for some squad video in the newest case, which has been requested.
Defense has received a global offer.
Defendant may appear by zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
See minutes from April 8, 2022 regarding reassignment.

03:03 PM Defendant Nnamdi A Opara in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court will not issue the stayed capias. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.

Court sets a signature bond of $500 with conditions.
Clerk to administratively transfer all the Defendant's cases to Branch 2.
Defendant may appear by zoom for the next hearing.



  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Hearing on April 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:55 AM Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court.   Defendant Nnamdi A Opara did not appear.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did not appear. Defendant indicated to his attorney that he had transportation issues. 
Defense requests court stay a capias.
Atty Nimmer is attempting to settle the cases with a global resolution. There is a new case.
Court imposes, but stays a capias.
Defendant must appear in-person to avoid capias being issued.
Court cancels the trial next week due to addition of the new case.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
